qas.question: What is the bus system called in Mexico City?
What is the bike-sharing program called in Mexico City?
How many days a week does the city encourage people to go without a car?
What pollutants does the city closely monitor?
How often do citizens need to get their cars examined?

context: To clean up pollution, the federal and local governments implemented numerous plans including the constant monitoring and reporting of environmental conditions, such as <a3_0>ozone and nitrogen oxides<a3_0/>. When the levels of these two pollutants reached critical levels, contingency actions were implemented which included closing factories, changing school hours, and extending the A day without a car program to <a2_0>two days<a2_0/> of the week. The government also instituted industrial technology improvements, a strict <a4_0>biannual<a4_0/> vehicle emission inspection and the reformulation of gasoline and diesel fuels. The introduction of <a0_0>Metrobús<a0_0/> bus rapid transit and the <a1_0>Ecobici<a1_0/> bike-sharing were among efforts to encourage alternate, greener forms of transportation.
